Events > April 24, 2018

#298 Community Feedback Session

In November, 2016, Chi Hack Night hosted a community feedback session. We asked how people were feeling about their government and their communities, and what they wanted to learn about. And we talked about how we could channel our energy into positive action. Some themes emerged. People wanted to facilitate conversations—preferably getting out of their filter bubbles—and increase their civic literacy, digital literacy, and media literacy.

Please join us for a facilitated group discussion to reflect on what we’ve done at Chi Hack Night in the last 18 months, share what’s important to us now, and come up with some ideas for taking action.

RSVP required Braintree now requires all attendees to RSVP beforehand. Walk-ins will not be allowed!

ASL This event will have an American Sign Language interpreter.

Food Food and drinks will be provided. We encourage attendees to bring their own water bottles to reduce waste.
